    Order

    Asterales

      Family (12)

      Asteraceae

        Genus (1755)

        Cirsium
          Prev genus | Next genus

          Display options

          Ver. 19.1
          March 1st, 2024

          512.0000 Family Asteraceae Dumort.; Comment. Bot. 55 (1822)
          1620 genera, ca. 29.000 spp. (35.000 spp. incl. microspecies). Systematics taken mostly from Funk et al. (2009, 2020) and other recent publications
          Species listed in database: 35215; hybrids: 675
          = Acarnaceae Link; (1829)
          = Ambrosiaceae Bercht. & J.Presl; Prir. Rostlin: 254 (1820), nom. cons.
          = Anthemidaceae Bercht. & J.Presl; Prir. Rostlin: 254 (1820)

          512.3221 Genus Cirsium Mill.; Gard. Dict. Abridg. Ed. 4 (1754)
          Distribution: N- and Central America, temp. Eurasia, many in Japan (66), few N- and trop. Africa. Many microspecies with uncertain status in Japan, and species delimitation in the Rocky Mountains remains controversial. The E-tropical African populations have recently been separated as Afrocirsium and Nuriaea.
          Species listed in database: 378; hybrids: 92
          = Ancanthia Steud.; Nomencl. Bot., ed. 2, 1: 85 (1840), nom. inval.
          = Ascalea Hill; Veg. Syst. 4: 14 (1762)

          Distribution: Iceland; Faeroe Isl.; England; Northern Ireland; Ireland; Denmark; Norway; Sweden; Finland; Netherlands; Belgium; Luxembourg; Germany (Brandenburg, Berlin, Baden-Württemberg, Bayern, Hessen, Hamburg, Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, Niedersachsen, Nordrhein-Westfalen, Rheinland-Pfalz, Schleswig-Holstein, Saarland, Sachsen, Sachsen-Anhalt, Thüringen); Switzerland; Liechtenstein; Austria; Poland; Czech Republic; Slovakia; Hungary; Portugal; Spain; Andorra; Baleares (Ibiza & Formentera, Mallorca, Menorca); France; Channel Isl.; Corsica; Sardinia; Italy; Sicily; San Marino; Slovenia; Croatia; Bosnia & Hercegovina; Montenegro; Serbia; Kosovo; North Macedonia; Albania; Romania; Bulgaria; European Turkey; Greece; S-European Russia; Estonia; Latvia; Lithuania; Belarus; C-European Russia; E-European Russia; N-European Russia; NW-European Russia (incl. Kaliningrad region); Moldova; Ukraine; Crimea; Algeria [I]; Azores; South Africa [I] (Mpulamanga [I], E-Cape Prov. [I]); Siberia (Altai, Buryatia, Krasnoyarsk, Tuva, W-Siberia); Russian Far East (Amur, Kamchatka, Khabarovsk, Kuril Isl., Magadan, Primorye, Sakhalin); Kazakhstan; Turkmenistan; Uzbekistan; Kyrgyzstan; Tajikistan; Northern Caucasus; Georgia [Caucasus]; Armenia; Azerbaijan (incl. Nachichevan); Turkey (E-Anatolia, Inner Anatolia, N-Anatolia, NE-Anatolia, NW-Anatolia: Bithynia, SE-Anatolia, SSW-Anatolia, SW-Anatolia); Iran (EC-Iran, E-Iran, NE-Iran: Mts., N-Iran, Iranian Aserbaijan, W-Iran); Afghanistan (Badakshan, Wakhan, Baghlan, Balkh, Bamyan, Ghazni, Ghorat, Helmand, Herat, Kabul, Kunar / Nuristan, Logar, Wardak, Nangarhar, Qunduz, Paktia / Khost, Takhar); China (Gansu, Xinjiang); Tibet; Mongolia; South Korea [I]; Pakistan (widespread); Nepal; India (Himachal Pradesh, Jammu & Kashmir, Punjab, Sikkim, Uttarakhand); Bangladesh; Australia [I] (Western Australia [I], South Australia [I], New South Wales [I], Victoria [I], Tasmania [I]); New Zealand [I]; Chatham Isl. [I]; Alaska [I]; Greenland [I]; Canada [I] (Alberta [I], British Columbia [I], Manitoba [I], New Brunswick [I], Newfoundland [I], N. W. T. [I], Nova Scotia [I], Ontario [I], Prince Edward Isl. [I], Québec [I], Saskatchewan [I], Yukon [I]); St. Pierre et Miquelon [I]; USA [I] (Alabama [I], Arizona [I], Arkansas [I], California [I], Colorado [I], Connecticut [I], Delaware [I], District of Columbia [I], Idaho [I], Illinois [I], Indiana [I], Iowa [I], Kansas [I], Kentucky [I], Maine [I], Maryland [I], Massachusetts [I], Michigan [I], Minnesota [I], Missouri [I], Montana [I], Nebraska [I], Nevada [I], New Hampshire [I], New Jersey [I], New Mexico [I], New York [I], North Carolina [I], North Dakota [I], Ohio [I], Oregon [I], Pennsylvania [I], Rhode Island [I], South Dakota [I], Tennessee [I], Texas [I], Utah [I], Vermont [I], Virginia [I], Washington [I], West Virginia [I], Wisconsin [I], Wyoming [I]); Brazil [I] (Minas Gerais [I]); Argentina [I]; Chile [I] (Valparaíso [I], Metropolitana de Santiago [I], Ñuble [I], Biobío [I], Araucanía [I], Aisén [I], Magallanes [I]); Falkland Isl.           = Cirsium ×foliosum Rhiner; 42 (1869), nom. illeg.
          species :
          Cirsium ×subalpinum Gaudin; Fl. Helv. 5: 182 (1829)

          A complete, synonymic checklist of the Higher Plants of the World

          Version 19.1 (March 1st, 2024)

          Covering 354,262 accepted species,
          8,619 hybrids, 47,813 accepted infraspecific taxa and 995,578 synonyms,
          in total 1,406,272* names

          [*about 25,000 dubious, "unplaced" names and about 4,000 invalid names (Art. 24.3) like "typicus" are deliberately omitted]

          With complete, detailed distribution data (countries and regions) and literature references

          Arranged in linear phylogenetic sequence reflecting true relationships

          Fully searchable and continously updated

          With 38,290 pictures of 15,532 species

          Assembled through 40 years independently from other databases

          In cooperation with Catalogue of Life

          Contact

          Dr. Michael Hassler

          Weiherbergstr. 77
          D-76646 Bruchsal
          Germany

          How to Cite:

          Hassler, Michael (1994 - 2024): World Plants. Synonymic Checklist and Distribution of the World Flora. Version 19.1; last update March 1st, 2024. - www.worldplants.de. Last accessed dd/mm/yyyy.
